thread.title: Bungling bouncy castle boss left red-faced after accidentally sending topless selfie to mum asking to book inflatables for tot’s birthday
thread.title_full: Bungling bouncy castle boss left red-faced after accidentally sending topless selfie to mum asking to book inflatables for tot’s birthday

author: pharper
title: Bungling bouncy castle boss left red-faced after accidentally sending topless selfie to mum asking to book inflatables for tot’s birthday
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A BOUNCY castle boss was left red-faced when he accidentally sent a TOPLESS PIC to a female customer. 
Bungling David Cooke claims he mistakenly sent a shot of his sweaty post-workout torso, instead of a bouncy castle, to a mum. Mercury Press Bouncy castle boss David Cooke was left embarrassed after sending this topless selfie to a female customer Mercury Press Since sharing the tongue-in-cheek picture online the business owner of 19 years has reportedly built up a considerable female fan-base Mercury Press Mr Cooke said that he had lost two stone after taking a gruelling eight-week training course in Thailand 
The mortified owner quickly apologised, texting “sorry sent wrong photo, how embarrassing”. 
But surprisingly the mum ignored the apology and booked the £50 jungle-themed toy for her tot’s christening. 
“It was so embarrassing,” said Mr Cooke from Upfield in East Sussex. 
“As soon as it read ‘sent’ I realised what had happened. 
“Bouncy castles are a very seasonal business with peak months being between May and October so last November I went to Thailand to do an eight-week fitness course. 
“While I was there the dietician advised me to take weekly progress pics to track my progress. 
“As I scrolled through the pics on my phone my thumb must have got stuck on that instead of ones of the bouncy castles and I hit send.” RELATED STORIES Woman accidentally posts topless selfie in rave online review of her new washing machine TOPLESS GUN RAF officer tried to send topless selfie to boyfriend but accidentally shared it with THOUSANDS of soldiers AN UNFORTUNATE SLIP-UP Actress left red-faced after accidentally flashing her boobs on Facebook Live YOU MUPPET! BBC newsreader Dan Walker left red-faced after getting a reporter’s name wrong 'You got the wrong guy' BBC Breakfast hosts red-faced as they introduce wrong guest in embarrassing blunder KILLER'S SICK POSTS Mother of teen kicked to death outraged as killer 'boasts about his easy life' in prison on Facebook 
The 37-year-old went on: “Pretty much everyone I know has seen it and had a good laugh. All the mums of the under-15s rugby team I help coach have joked about it. 
“I apologised straightaway but she didn’t really acknowledge it – though she probably had a laugh. 
“I really need to put my pictures of the bouncy castles in a separate folder to my camera roll to make sure it doesn’t happen again. 
“I’ve learned my lesson and now double-check every picture before I hit send.” 
We pay for your stories! Do you have a story for The Sun Online news team? Email us at or call 0207 782 4368
